含义: The character '易' primarily means 'easy' or 'simple'. It can also mean 'to change' or 'exchange', reflecting its dual nature in conveying both simplicity and transformation.
字形: '易' is composed of two parts: the upper part '日' (sun) and the lower part '勿' (do not). The structure symbolizes the sun rising and setting, indicating change and the passage of time.
读音: The pronunciation of '易' is 'yì' in Mandarin.
字源: The character '易' originates from ancient Chinese pictographs representing the sun and its movement, symbolizing change and transformation. Over time, it evolved to represent concepts of ease and simplicity.
常用词组: 易经 (yì jīng) - Book of Changes
易学 (yì xué) - easy to learn
成语: 易如反掌 (yì rú fǎn zhǎng) - as easy as turning one's hand
易地而处 (yì dì ér chǔ) - to put oneself in another's place
易子而食 (yì zǐ ér shí) - to exchange children for food (a desperate act in famine)
易守难攻 (yì shǒu nán gōng) - easy to defend, hard to attack
例句: 这个问题很容易解决。 (Zhè ge wèn tí hěn róng yì jiě jué.) - This problem is easy to solve.
易经是中国古代的一部重要经典。 (Yì jīng shì zhōng guó gǔ dài de yī bù zhòng yào jīng diǎn.) - The Book of Changes is an important classic in ancient China.
短故事: In ancient times, a scholar studied the 'Book of Changes' to understand the patterns of the universe. Through his studies, he gained wisdom and was able to predict changes in the weather, helping his village prepare for seasons of drought and flood.
A merchant used the principles of '易' (change) to adapt his business strategies according to market trends, ensuring his trade flourished even in times of economic uncertainty.
诗词: 《易经》有云：'易有太极，是生两仪。' (Yì jīng yǒu yún: 'Yì yǒu tài jí, shì shēng liǎng yí.') - The Book of Changes says: 'From the Great Ultimate come the Two Forms.'

李白诗云：'易水萧萧西风冷，满座衣冠似雪。' (Lǐ bái shī yún: 'Yì shuǐ xiāo xiāo xī fēng lěng, mǎn zuò yī guān sì xuě.') - Li Bai's poem: 'The Yi River is desolate, the west wind cold, all dressed in white as if covered in snow.'
